direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods iterate over elements, but 'stream()' provides a more modern and flexible approach using Java Streams.
Both methods involve traversing the element tree, but 'traverse' uses a visitor pattern for more granular control.
Both methods involve iterating over elements, but 'filter' allows for conditional traversal based on a filter.
Both methods can be used to select elements, but 'select' uses CSS selectors for more specific targeting.
Both methods involve selecting elements, but 'selectFirst' stops after finding the first match.
Both methods involve selecting elements, but 'expectFirst' throws an exception if no match is found.
Both methods involve checking elements, but 'is' checks if an element matches a given CSS query.
Both methods involve traversing elements, but 'closest' finds the nearest ancestor matching a query.
Both methods involve selecting elements, but 'selectXpath' uses XPath expressions for more complex queries.
